results.definition: a piece of cloth that is left over after the rest has been used or sold
bring to an end or halt
examples: She ended their friendship when she found out that he had once been convicted of a crime

results.definition: be the end of; be the last or concluding part of
examples: This sad scene ended the movie

results.definition: the state of affairs that a plan is intended to achieve and that (when achieved) terminates behavior intended to achieve it
examples: the ends justify the means

results.definition: the last section of a communication
the point in time at which something ends
examples: the end of the year
the ending of warranty period

results.definition: have an end, in a temporal, spatial, or quantitative sense; either spatial or metaphorical
examples: My property ends by the bushes
The symphony ends in a pianissimo

results.definition: the final stage or concluding parts of an event or occurrence
examples: the end was exciting
he came to a bad end
the so-called glorious experiment came to an inglorious end

results.definition: either extremity of something that has length
examples: the end of the pier
she knotted the end of the thread
they rode to the end of the line

results.definition: a boundary marking the extremities of something
examples: the end of town
we have given it at the end of the section since it involves the calculus
Start at the beginning and go on until you come to the end

results.definition: (American football) a position on the line of scrimmage
examples: no one wanted to play end

results.definition: (football) the person who plays at one end of the line of scrimmage
examples: the end managed to hold onto the pass

results.definition: one of two places from which people are communicating to each other
examples: the phone rang at the other end
both ends wrote at the same time
The terrible news ended our hopes that he had survived

results.definition: the part you are expected to play
examples: he held up his end

results.definition: the surface at either extremity of a three-dimensional object
examples: one end of the box was marked `This side up'
